recipes.cooking_method:
1. Cook spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water, then drain spaghetti.
2. In a large skillet, cook pancetta over medium heat until crisp. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat.
3. In a bowl, whisk together egg yolks and Parmesan. Add reserved pasta cooking water to the pancetta mixture, then slowly whisk in egg mixture. Add spaghetti and toss until coated.
4. Serve immediately, garnished with additional Parmesan cheese.

1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. In a shallow dish, mix together breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese. In another shallow dish, beat eggs.
3. Dip each chicken breast in beaten eggs, then coat in breadcrumb mixture. Place on prepared baking sheet.
4. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through. Top with marinara sauce and additional Parmesan cheese, if desired. Bake for an additional 5-10 minutes.
5. Serve hot.

1. Preheat oven to 450°F. Grease a pizza pan with olive oil.
2. On a floured surface, roll out pizza dough into a circle. Place on prepared pizza pan.
3. Spread tomato sauce evenly over pizza dough, leaving a 1-inch border. Top with sliced mozzarella cheese.
4. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted.
5. Remove from oven and sprinkle with chopped fresh basil. Drizzle with olive oil.
6. Serve hot.
